title: Jack Smith speaks on Trump indictment in 2020 election interference case
description: Special counsel Jack Smith delivered remarks on the charges former President Trump faces from a federal grand jury's investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Fitch downgrades U.S. credit rating from top score after debt ceiling crisis
description: Fitch downgraded its credit rating for the U.S. government, from AAA to AA+, two months after the debt-ceiling crisis was resolved.

title: Grand jury accuses Trump of conspiring to defraud the United States
description: The latest news and updates after Donald Trump was indicted by the grand jury investigating the 2020 election and efforts to overturn his defeat.

title: Trump attacks special counsel on Truth Social as grand jury leaves courthouse
description: The grand jury examining Trump's role in the Jan. 6 riot and efforts to overturn the 2020 election is arriving at the federal courthouse in Washington.

title: How Nikki Haley and Vivek Ramaswamy are taking different approaches to identity on the campaign trail
description: Vivek Ramaswamy and Nikki Haley have very different approaches when talking about racial identity as they make bids for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Prosecutors have surveillance videos and 2,500 pages of documents on Gilgo Beach suspect
description: RIVERHEAD, N.Y. — The evidence against Rex Heuermann, the 59-year-old architect charged in the Gilgo Beach serial killings, includes 2,500 pages of documents, crime scene photographs, autopsy reports, and hundreds of hours of video footage taken at Heuermann's home and office, prosecutors said Tuesday.

title: 'Outrage Machine': How social media thrives on divisive content
description: Social media platforms, like Twitter, have become an "Outrage Machine," with moral outrage going viral and driving engagement, leading to divisive content and potential harm to democracy. Author of "Outrage Machine" and Media researcher Tobias Rose-Stockwell joins Morning Joe to discuss how social media platforms incentivize divisive content and offers practical solutions at the individual, platform, and government levels to combat the outrage cycle and foster a more positive online experience.

title: N.J. Lt. Gov. Sheila Oliver dies after hospitalization for unspecified 'medical care'
description: New Jersey Lt. Gov. Sheila Oliver, the state's first Black Assembly speaker, has passed away after she was hospitalized for an undisclosed medical issue, her family announced.

title: Can AI solve the government's giant, growing backlog of public records requests?
description: AI holds potential to help reduce a staggering backlog of FOIA requests, but critics warn it could create more problems

title: Should Ozempic come with a warning about a risk of suicidal thoughts?
description: A small number patients have reported developing suicidal thoughts while taking Ozempic or Wegovy. But clinical trials did not find evidence of an increased risk.

title: Elon Musk's X Corp. sues nonprofit group that tracks hate speech
description: X Corp., the parent company of the social media platform formerly known as Twitter, filed a lawsuit against a nonprofit organization that monitors hate speech.

title: 'Am I wrong?': Ohio officer who released police dog on Black man defends himself on body cam video
description: Ryan Speakman, the Circleville, Ohio, police officer who was fired after releasing a police dog on a Black man with his hands raised, appeared to defend his actions in the immediate aftermath of the incident, according to new body camera footage.

title: Fulton County DA Fani Willis shares racist threat as Trump probe nears a conclusion
description: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis, who is  investigating Donald Trump's attempts to overturn the 2020 election, said she received a racist threat.

title: Former Lizzo dancers were weight-shamed and pressured while at strip club, lawsuit says
description: LOS ANGELES — Three of Lizzo’s former dancers have accused the singer of sexual harassment and creating a hostile work environment, according to a lawsuit filed Tuesday.

title: Amazon adds video telemedicine visits nationwide to its virtual clinic
description: Amazon is adding video telemedicine visits in all 50 states to a virtual clinic it launched last fall, as the retail giant takes a deeper step into care delivery.

title: What to expect from Elon Musk's X lawsuit against anti-hate speech group
description: X Corp., the parent company of the app formerly known as Twitter, has filed a lawsuit against the Center for Countering Digital Hate, a nonprofit organization that researches digital hate speech and misinformation. NBC News’ Danny Cevallos explains X’s grounds of the lawsuit and the chances of a countersuit.

title: Wife of suspect in Gilgo Beach killings says her children ‘cry themselves to sleep’ following his arrest
description: The estranged wife of the Manhattan architect charged in the Gilgo Beach serial killings says her two children “cry themselves to sleep” and she has “no answers” for them when they ask about her husband’s arrest.

title: Impeached Texas AG Ken Paxton seeks to have most charges dismissed before September trial
description: Lawyers for impeached Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton sought to have most of the charges dismissed before his trial begins in the state Senate on Sept. 5.

title: Florida's SAT alternative and remembering Paul Reubens: Morning Rundown
description: Lori Vallow life sentence, Hunter Biden associate testifies, Devon Archer testifies, China zoo bear, Memphis Hebrew school gunman, Biden Space Command, Ron DeSantis reset

title: Zoo in China denies speculation that its bears are actually humans in disguise
description: HONG KONG — A zoo in eastern China has denied suggestions that its bears are in fact people dressed in costumes, after a video of one standing like a human went viral on social media.

title: As Virginia and Maryland vie for the FBI's new HQ, conservatives want to defund it
description: Republicans want to defund the new FBI headquarters, stepping into a fight between Maryland and Virginia, as they probe a "weaponized" federal government.

title: CEO of HCA hospital in Florida that allegedly had roaches in the operating room leaves job
description: The CEO of HCA Florida Bayonet Point, a hospital whose physicians characterized it as unsafe and unclean in an NBC News report, has left after less than four years.

title: Bed Bath & Beyond comes back as an online retailer
description: Bed Bath & Beyond's website relaunched Tuesday under its new owner, Overstock.com, breathing new life to the iconic home goods retailer declared bankrupt earlier this year.

title: U.S. women’s soccer team faces Portugal in final World Cup group match
description: U.S. women’s soccer team faces Portugal in final World Cup group match

title: Trump's legal woes are costing his political operation millions of dollars
description: Trump’s Save America PAC has doled out payments to more than 40 different law firms and spent more than $20 million, new campaign finance reports show.

title: Flashing ‘X’ sign at Twitter building appears to come down
description: The flashing “X” sign above the San Francisco building formerly known as Twitter’s headquarters has been removed, video shows, days after it went up and caused complaints about the nighttime display.

title: U.S. sees 'narrow opportunity' to reverse coup in Niger as ousted president meets Chad’s leader
description: The Biden administration still sees a “narrow opportunity” to reverse the coup in Niger, a senior official said, as Chad’s leader met with the ousted president in a bid to resolve the crisis

title: Trump receives deposition notice in his $500 million lawsuit against Michael Cohen
description: Former President Donald Trump alleges that his former lawyer turned critic spread falsehoods, violated attorney-client privilege and unjustly enriched himself.

title: Biden spoke with son's business associates numerous times, former partner tells lawmakers
description: Rep. Daniel Goldman said Devon Archer told lawmakers that Hunter Biden put his father on speakerphone with business partners about 20 times, but they didn't talk business.
